subject: Attention: Beneficiary
body:
Attention: Beneficiary
Due to Covid, the US Government arrangement with the World Bank and
the United Nations , African image has been destroyed by the Scam /
Fraudulent Government Officials, the World Bank and the United Nation
are Paying all the Scam victims US$200,000 as compensation.
So therefore, your email address are among the first batch of 500
beneficiary that are to benefit the US$200,000 each, and it has been
made available through ATM Master Card, and it has been forwarded to
the EMS Express Courier for the onward shipment to your address.
Furthermore, You are to contact the EMS Express Courier through the
bellow email address and reconfirm your Name and address to them, to
enable them ship the ATM Master Card to your address. Bellow is the
EMS Express Courier Information:
EMS Express Courier Details:
Contact Name: Rev. Mr Gerald Kasper
Email: 
kasperg173@gmail.com
Contact them Immediately with your Compensation Identification Parcel
Number: FEDGOV759, as well as your Name and full Address, You should
quote the Number when contacting them to avoid embarrassment.
Thanks for your Understanding and patience.
Yours sincerely,
Mr Walsh Philip
CitiBank Group

subject: Re:    Attention: Beneficiary
body:
Dear Mr. Walsh Philip,

Thank you for your email and the information provided. I am glad to hear that efforts are being made to compensate victims of scams.

However, before proceeding further, I would like to clarify a few things:

1. Could you please provide more details about this compensation program? Who is eligible and what are the criteria for selection?

2. You mentioned an ATM Master Card - could you explain how this works? Is it a prepaid card with the compensation amount loaded onto it?

3. Regarding the EMS Express Courier, could you provide their contact details? The email address seems to be missing from your message.

4. Lastly, you mentioned a parcel number that needs to be quoted when contacting EMS Express Courier. Could you please provide this number?

I look forward to your response.

Best wishes,
George
